Package ohos.agp.components

Class ProgressBar

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.components.Component
      • ohos.agp.components.ProgressBar
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbsSlider, RoundProgressBar

    public class ProgressBar
extends Component
    Provides an element for indicating the progress of an operation on the UI.

    The progress bar supports the determinate and indeterminate types. The progress bar is displayed on a UI or in a notification without interrupting users.

    Indeterminate Progress

    The indeterminate progress bar is used when the time required for the operation is uncertain.

    Determinate Progress

    The determinate progress bar is used when you need to display the specific quantity of progress of the operation. You can use the setProgressValue(int) function to update the current progress. By default, when the progress value displayed on the progress bar reaches 100, the operation is complete.

    Since:
    1

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  ProgressBar.BarObserver
      Provides a text observer to listen for changes of progress bars in a component.

      • setMinValue

        public void setMinValue​(int min)
        Sets the lower limit of a progress bar.

        This method displays the lower limit of the progress bar when the actual progress is less than the lower limit.

        Parameters:
        min - Indicates the lower limit of the progress bar.
        Since:
        4

      • setMaxValue

        public void setMaxValue​(int max)
        Sets the upper limit for the progress bar.

        This method displays the upper limit on the progress bar when the actual progress is greater than the upper limit.

        Parameters:
        max - Indicates the upper limit of the progress bar.
        Since:
        4

      • setProgressValue

        public void setProgressValue​(int progress)
        Sets the current progress for the progress bar.

        This method updates the progress indicator immediately.

        Parameters:
        progress - Indicates a progress value between getMin() and getMax().
        Since:
        4

      • setViceProgress

        public void setViceProgress​(int progress)
        Sets the secondary progress value of a progress bar.
        Parameters:
        progress - Indicates the secondary progress value, which must be within the range of getMin() and getMax().
        Since:
        4

      • setStep

        public void setStep​(int step)
        Sets the progress step.

        This method sets the step for increasing or decreasing the progress value. The default value is 1. If the step is 10, the progress value is a multiple of 10.

        Parameters:
        step - Indicates the progress step.
        Since:
        1

      • setIndeterminate

        public void setIndeterminate​(boolean indeterminate)
        Sets whether to enable indeterminate mode for a progress bar.

        If the indeterminate mode is disabled, the progress value will be displayed. If the indeterminate mode is enabled, an animation in infinite loop will be displayed.

        Parameters:
        indeterminate - Indicates whether to enable indeterminate mode for the progress bar. true means to enable indeterminate mode; false means otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • isIndeterminate

        public boolean isIndeterminate​()
        Checks whether the indeterminate mode is enabled.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the indeterminate mode is enabled; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • setInfiniteModeElement

        public void setInfiniteModeElement​(Element element)
        Sets the element object used to draw an indeterminate progress bar.

        The element object repeats rotating clockwise around its center.

        Parameters:
        element - Indicates the element object.
        Since:
        4

      • setMaxWidth

        public void setMaxWidth​(int maxWidth)
        Sets the maximum width of the progress bar.

        If the width provided by the parent layout is greater than the maximum width, the maximum width is used for drawing.

        Parameters:
        maxWidth - Indicates the maximum width of the progress bar.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        getMaxWidth()

      • setMaxHeight

        public void setMaxHeight​(int maxHeight)

        Parameters:
        maxHeight - Indicates the maximum height.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:

      • getInfiniteModeElement

        public Element getInfiniteModeElement​()
        Obtains the element object used to draw an indeterminate progress bar.

        The element object repeats rotating clockwise around its center.

        Returns:
        Returns the element object.
        Since:
        4

      • getMin

        public int getMin​()
        Obtains the lower limit of a determinate progress bar.

        By default, the lower limit is 0.

        Returns:
        Returns the lower limit of the determinate progress bar, which is 0 or a positive integer.
        Since:
        1

      • getMax

        public int getMax​()
        Obtains the upper limit of a determinate progress bar.

        By default, the upper limit is 100.

        Returns:
        Returns the upper limit of the determinate progress bar, which is a positive integer.
        Since:
        1

      • getProgress

        public int getProgress​()
        Obtains the current progress value of the progress bar.

        This method obtains the current progress value of a determinate progress bar. By default, the initial value is set to the lower limit.

        Returns:
        Returns the progress value, which is an integer.
        Since:
        1

      • getViceProgressValue

        public int getViceProgressValue​()
        Obtains the secondary progress value of a progress bar.
        Returns:
        Returns the secondary progress value of the progress bar.
        Since:
        4

      • getStep

        public int getStep​()
        Obtains the progress step of a progress bar.

        The progress value can only be a multiple of the progress step. The progress step is set to 1 by default.

        Returns:
        Returns the progress step of the progress bar, which is a positive integer.
        Since:
        1

      • isInfiniteMode

        public boolean isInfiniteMode​()
        Checks if the indeterminate mode is enabled for a progress bar.

        The determinate mode indicates that a certain progress value is displayed on the progress bar to show the current progress. The indeterminate mode indicates that the progress value is unavailable, and a element object that repeats rotating clockwise around its center is displayed to show the ongoing status of the operation.

        Returns:
        Returns true if indeterminate mode is enabled for the progress bar; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • getMaxWidth

        public int getMaxWidth​()
        Obtains the maximum width of a progress bar.

        This method compares the maximum width of the progress bar with that provided by the parent component. If the width provided by the parent component exceeds the maximum width, the progress bar will be drawn using its maximum width.

        Returns:
        Returns the maximum width of the progress bar.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        setMaxWidth(int)

      • getMaxHeight

        public int getMaxHeight​()

        Returns:
        Returns the maximum height of the progress bar.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        setMaxHeight(int)

      • addBarObserver

        public void addBarObserver​(ProgressBar.BarObserver observer)
        Adds a BarObserver to monitor changes of this progress bar.

        You must implement BarObserver#onBarChanged before using the BarObserver.

        Parameters:
        observer - Indicates the bar observer to add.
        Since:
        4

      • removeBarObserver
